intro: Adenocalymma magdalenense, commonly known as the Magdalena burr, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Colombia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It typically grows in dry, disturbed habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
